Parameter.Description: The number of transaction queue entries

Parameter.Name: clock
Parameter.Description: Internal Controller Clock Rate.

Parameter.Name: memory_clock
Parameter.Description: NVM Chips Clock Rate.

Parameter.Name: size
Parameter.Description: The size of the whole NVM-Based DIMM in KBs

Parameter.Name: write_buffer_size
Parameter.Description: The size of the internal write buffer (# entries)

Parameter.Name: max_requests
Parameter.Description: This determines the max number of requests can be buffered at the NVMDIMM

Parameter.Name: max_outstanding
Parameter.Description: This determines the max number of outstanding/executing requests inside the NVMDIMM

Parameter.Name: max_current_weight
Parameter.Description: Determines the power limit, which in turn limits the outstanding requests

Parameter.Name: write_weight
Parameter.Description: Determines the average power weight of a currently executing write operation

Parameter.Name: read_weight
Parameter.Description: Determines the average power weight of a currently executing read operation

Parameter.Name: tCMD
Parameter.Description: The time needed to send a command from the controller to the NVM-Chip (in controller cycles)

Parameter.Name: tCL
Parameter.Description: The time needed to read a word from an already activated row (in controller cycles)

Parameter.Name: tCL_W
Parameter.Description: The time needed to write a word completely to the PCM Chip (in controller cycles)

Parameter.Name: tRCD
Parameter.Description: The time needed to activate a row in PCM chips (in controller cycles)

Parameter.Name: tBURST
Parameter.Description: The time needed for submitting a data burst on the bus

Parameter.Name: device_width
Parameter.Description: This determines the NVM-Chip output width

Parameter.Name: num_devices
Parameter.Description: The number of NVM-Chip devices

Parameter.Name: num_ranks
Parameter.Description: The number of ranks

Parameter.Name: num_banks
Parameter.Description: The number of banks on each rank

Parameter.Name: cache_enabled
Parameter.Description: If internal cache is enabled or not

Parameter.Name: modulo
Parameter.Description: If internal modulo scheduling is enabled or not

Parameter.Name: modulo_unit
Parameter.Description: The unit of module, if N, this means for each N reads, we service a write

Parameter.Name: cache_persistent
Parameter.Description: There is enough power to write-back the cache

Parameter.Name: cache_latency
Parameter.Description: The cache latency

Parameter.Name: cache_size
Parameter.Description: The cache size in KBs

Parameter.Name: cache_bs
Parameter.Description: The cache block size

Parameter.Name: cache_assoc
Parameter.Description: The cache associativity

Parameter.Name: row_buffer_size
Parameter.Description: The row buffer size in bytes

Parameter.Name: flush_th
Parameter.Description: This determines the percentage of max number of entries in write buffer that triggers flushing it

Parameter.Name: flush_th_low
Parameter.Description: This determines the percentage of the low threshold number of entries

Parameter.Name: max_writes
Parameter.Description: This determines the maximum number of concurrent writes at NVM chips (not including those on buffer

Parameter.Name: cacheline_interleaving
Parameter.Description: This determines if cacheline interleaving is used (1) or bank interleaving (0)

Parameter.Name: adaptive_writes
Parameter.Description: This indicates that the writes flushing mode: 0 means naive interleaving

Parameter.Name: write_cancel
Parameter.Description: This indicates that the write cancellation optimization: 0 means not enabled

Parameter.Name: write_cancel_th
Parameter.Description: This indicates that the write cancellation threshold: 0 means dynamic

Parameter.Name: group_size
Parameter.Description: This indicates the number of banks in each group, to be locked when draining

Parameter.Name: lock_period
Parameter.Description: This indicates the period of locking a group in cycles

Port.Name: bus
Port.Description: Link to the socket controller

Statistic.Name: reads
Statistic.Description: Determine the number of reads

Statistic.Name: writes
Statistic.Description: Determine the number of writes

Statistic.Name: avg_time
Statistic.Description: The average time spent on each read request

Statistic.Name: histogram_idle
Statistic.Description: The histogram of cycles length while controller is idle

Component.Name: Samba
Component.Description: Memory Management Unit (MMU) Component of SST

Parameter.Name: corecount
Parameter.Description: Number of CPU cores to emulate, i.e., number of private Sambas

Parameter.Name: levels
Parameter.Description: Number of TLB levels per Samba

Parameter.Name: perfect
Parameter.Description: This is set to 1, when modeling an ideal TLB hierachy with 100% hit rate

Parameter.Name: os_page_size
Parameter.Description: This represents the size of frames the OS allocates in KB

Parameter.Name: sizes_L%(levels)
Parameter.Description: Number of page sizes supported by Samba

Parameter.Name: page_size%(sizes)_L%(levels)d
Parameter.Description: the page size of the supported page size number x in level y

Parameter.Name: max_outstanding_L%(levels)d
Parameter.Description: the number of max outstanding misses

Parameter.Name: max_width_L%(levels)d
Parameter.Description: the number of accesses on the same cycle

Parameter.Name: size%(sizes)_L%(levels)d
Parameter.Description: the number of entries of page size number x on level y

Parameter.Name: upper_link_L%(levels)d
Parameter.Description: the latency of the upper link connects to this structure

Parameter.Name: assoc%(sizes)_L%(levels)d
Parameter.Description: the associativity of size number X in Level Y

Parameter.Name: clock
Parameter.Description: the clock frequency

Parameter.Name: latency_L%(levels)d
Parameter.Description: the access latency in cycles for this level of memory

Parameter.Name: parallel_mode_L%(levels)d
Parameter.Description: this is for the corner case of having a one cycle overlap with accessing cache

Parameter.Name: page_walk_latency
Parameter.Description: Each page table walk latency in nanoseconds

Parameter.Name: self_connected
Parameter.Description: Determines if the page walkers are acutally connected to memory hierarchy or just add fixed latency (self-connected)

Parameter.Name: emulate_faults
Parameter.Description: This indicates if the page faults should be emulated through requesting pages from page fault handler

SubComponentSlot.Name: pagefaulthandler
SubComponentSlot.Description: subcomponent to manage page faults

Port.Name: cpu_to_mmu%(corecount)d
Port.Description: Each Samba has link to its core

Port.Name: mmu_to_cache%(corecount)d
Port.Description: Each Samba to its corresponding cache

Port.Name: ptw_to_mem%(corecount)d
Port.Description: Each TLB hierarchy has a link to the memory for page walking

Port.Name: alloc_link_%(corecount)d
Port.Description: Each core's link to an allocation tracker (e.g. memSieve)

Statistic.Name: tlb_hits
Statistic.Description: Number of TLB hits

Statistic.Name: tlb_misses
Statistic.Description: Number of TLB misses

Statistic.Name: total_waiting
Statistic.Description: The total waiting time

Statistic.Name: write_requests
Statistic.Description: Stat write_requests

Statistic.Name: tlb_shootdown
Statistic.Description: Number of TLB clears because of page-frees

Statistic.Name: tlb_page_allocs
Statistic.Description: Number of pages allocated by the memory manager

Component.Name: VaultSimC
Component.Description: A memory vault in a stacked memory

Parameter.Name: clock
Parameter.Description: Vault Clock Rate.

Parameter.Name: numVaults2
Parameter.Description: Number of bits to determine vault address (i.e. log_2(number of vaults per cube))

Parameter.Name: VaultID
Parameter.Description: Vault Unique ID (Unique to cube).

Parameter.Name: debug
Parameter.Description: 0 (default): No debugging, 1: STDOUT, 2: STDERR, 3: FILE.

Parameter.Name: delay
Parameter.Description: Static vault delay

Port.Name: bus
Port.Description: Link to the logic layer

Statistic.Name: Mem_Outstanding
Statistic.Description: Number of memory requests outstanding each cycle

Parameter.Name: clock
Parameter.Description: Simple CPU Clock Rate.

Parameter.Name: threads
Parameter.Description: Number of simulated threads in cpu.

Parameter.Name: app
Parameter.Description: Synthetic Application. 0:miniMD-like 1:phdMesh-like. (See app.cpp for details).

Parameter.Name: bwlimit
Parameter.Description: Maximum number of memory instructions issued by the processor per cycle. Note, each thread can only have at most 2 outstanding memory references at a time.

Parameter.Name: seed
Parameter.Description: Optional random number generator seed. If not defined or 0, uses srandomdev().

Port.Name: toMem
Port.Description: Link to the memory system

Component.Name: logicLayer
Component.Description: A logic layer in a stacked memory

Parameter.Name: clock
Parameter.Description: Logic Layer Clock Rate.

Parameter.Name: llID
Parameter.Description: Logic Layer ID (Unique id within chain)

Parameter.Name: bwlimit
Parameter.Description: Number of memory events which can be processed per cycle per link.

Parameter.Name: LL_MASK
Parameter.Description: Bitmask to determine 'ownership' of an address by a cube. A cube 'owns' an address if ((((addr >> LL_SHIFT) & LL_MASK) == llID) || (LL_MASK == 0)). LL_SHIFT is set in vaultGlobals.h and is 8 by default.

Parameter.Name: terminal
Parameter.Description: Is this the last cube in the chain?

Parameter.Name: vaults
Parameter.Description: Number of vaults per cube.

Parameter.Name: debug
Parameter.Description: 0 (default): No debugging, 1: STDOUT, 2: STDERR, 3: FILE.

Port.Name: bus_%(vaults)d
Port.Description: Link to the individual memory vaults

Port.Name: toCPU
Port.Description: Connection towards the processor (directly to the proessor, or down the chain in the direction of the processor)

Port.Name: toMem
Port.Description: If 'terminal' is 0 (i.e. this is not the last cube in the chain) then this port connects to the next cube.

Statistic.Name: BW_recv_from_CPU
Statistic.Description: Bandwidth used (recieves from the CPU by the LL) per cycle (in messages)

Statistic.Name: BW_send_to_CPU
Statistic.Description: Bandwidth used (sends from the CPU by the LL) per cycle (in messages)

Statistic.Name: BW_recv_from_Mem
Statistic.Description: Bandwidth used (recieves from other memories by the LL) per cycle (in messages)

Statistic.Name: BW_send_to_Mem
Statistic.Description: Bandwidth used (sends from other memories by the LL) per cycle (in messages)

Parameter.Name: clock
Parameter.Description: Frequency, same as system clock frequency

Parameter.Name: statsPrefix
Parameter.Description: writes stats to statsPrefix file

Parameter.Name: tracePrefix
Parameter.Description: writes trace to tracePrefix tracing is enable

Parameter.Name: debug
Parameter.Description: Print debug statements with increasing verbosity [0-10]

Parameter.Name: statistics
Parameter.Description: 0-No-stats, 1-print-stats

Parameter.Name: pageSize
Parameter.Description: Page Size (bytes), used for selecting number of bins for address histogram

Parameter.Name: accessLatencyBins
Parameter.Description: Number of bins for access latency histogram10

Port.Name: northBus
Port.Description: Connect towards cpu side

Port.Name: southBus
Port.Description: Connect towards memory side

Parameter.Name: addr_cutoff
Parameter.Description: Addresses above this cutoff won't be recorded

Parameter.Name: virtual_addr
Parameter.Description: Record virtual addresses (1) or physical (0)

Statistic.Name: histogram_reads
Statistic.Description: Histogram of page read counts

Statistic.Name: histogram_writes
Statistic.Description: Histogram of page write counts

Parameter.Name: cache_line_size
Parameter.Description: Size of the cache line the prefetcher is attached to

Statistic.Name: prefetches_issued
Statistic.Description: Number of prefetch requests issued

Statistic.Name: miss_events_processed
Statistic.Description: Number of cache misses received

Statistic.Name: hit_events_processed
Statistic.Description: Number of cache hits received

Parameter.Name: verbose
Parameter.Description: Controls the verbosity of the cassini components

Parameter.Name: cache_line_size
Parameter.Description: Controls the cache line size of the cache the prefetcher is attached too

Parameter.Name: history
Parameter.Description: Start of Address Range, for this controller.

Parameter.Name: reach
Parameter.Description: Reach of the prefetcher (ie how far forward to make requests)

Parameter.Name: detect_range
Parameter.Description: Range to detact addresses over in request-counts, default is 4.

Parameter.Name: address_count
Parameter.Description: Number of addresses to keep in the prefetch table

Parameter.Name: page_size
Parameter.Description: Start of Address Range, for this controller.

Parameter.Name: overrun_page_boundaries
Parameter.Description: Allow prefetcher to run over page alignment boundaries, default is 0 (false)

Parameter.Name: tag_size
Parameter.Description: Number of bits used for address matching in table

Parameter.Name: addr_size
Parameter.Description: Number of bits used for addresses

Statistic.Name: prefetches_issued
Statistic.Description: Counts number of prefetches issued

Statistic.Name: prefetches_canceled_by_page_boundary
Statistic.Description: Counts number of prefetches which spanned over page boundaries and so did not issue

Statistic.Name: prefetches_canceled_by_history
Statistic.Description: Counts number of prefetches which did not get issued because of prefetch history

Statistic.Name: prefetch_opportunities
Statistic.Description: Counts the number of prefetch opportunities

Parameter.Name: verbose
Parameter.Description: Controls the verbosity of the Cassini component

Parameter.Name: cache_line_size
Parameter.Description: Size of the cache line the prefetcher is attached to

Parameter.Name: history
Parameter.Description: Number of entries to keep for historical comparison

Parameter.Name: reach
Parameter.Description: Reach (how far forward the prefetcher should fetch lines)

Parameter.Name: detect_range
Parameter.Description: Range to detect addresses over in request counts

Parameter.Name: address_count
Parameter.Description: Number of addresses to keep in prefetch table

Parameter.Name: page_size
Parameter.Description: Page size for this controller

Parameter.Name: overrun_page_boundaries
Parameter.Description: Allow prefetcher to run over page boundaries, 0 is no, 1 is yes

Statistic.Name: prefetches_issued
Statistic.Description: Number of prefetch requests issued

Statistic.Name: prefetches_canceled_by_page_boundary
Statistic.Description: Prefetches which would not be executed because they span over a page boundary.

Statistic.Name: prefetches_canceled_by_history
Statistic.Description: Prefetches which did not get issued because of a prefetch history in the table

Statistic.Name: prefetch_opportunities
Statistic.Description: Count of opportunities to prefetch

Parameter.Name: addr_cutoff
Parameter.Description: Addresses above this cutoff won't be recorded

Statistic.Name: hist_reads_log2
Statistic.Description: Histogram of log2(cacheline reads before eviction)

Statistic.Name: hist_writes_log2
Statistic.Description: Histogram of log2(cacheline write before eviction)

Statistic.Name: hist_age_log2
Statistic.Description: Histogram of log2(cacheline ages before eviction)

Statistic.Name: hist_word_accesses
Statistic.Description: Histogram of cacheline words accessed before eviction

Statistic.Name: evicts
Statistic.Description: Number of evictions seen

Parameter.Name: verbose
Parameter.Description: Sets the output verbosity of the component

Parameter.Name: jobId
Parameter.Description: Sets the job id

Parameter.Name: netMapName
Parameter.Description: used internally

Parameter.Name: _apiName
Parameter.Description: used internally

Parameter.Name: _jobId
Parameter.Description: used internally

Parameter.Name: _motifNum
Parameter.Description: used internally

Parameter.Name: motif_count
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of motifs which will be run in this simulation, default is 1

Parameter.Name: distribModule
Parameter.Description: Sets the distribution SST module for compute modeling, default is a constant distribution of mean 1

Parameter.Name: rankmapper
Parameter.Description: Sets the rank mapping SST module to load to rank translations, default is linear mapping

Parameter.Name: mapFile
Parameter.Description: Sets the name of the input file for custom map

Parameter.Name: motif%(motif_count)d
Parameter.Description: Sets the event generator or motif for the engine

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Description: Sets the event generator or motif for the engine

Parameter.Name: api
Parameter.Description: Sets the api used by a motif

Parameter.Name: spyplotmode
Parameter.Description: Sets the spyplot generation mode, 0 = none, 1 = spy on sends

Parameter.Name: motifLog
Parameter.Description: Sets a file path to a file where motif execution details are written, empty = no log

Port.Name: detailed%(num_vNics)d
Port.Description: Port connected to the detailed model

Port.Name: nic
Port.Description: Port connected to the nic

Port.Name: loop
Port.Description: Port connected to the loopBack

Port.Name: memoryHeap
Port.Description: Port connected to the memory heap

Parameter.Name: arg.fieldspercell
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of fields per mesh cell

Parameter.Name: arg.verbose
Parameter.Description: Sets the verbosity of the output

Parameter.Name: arg.iterations
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of ping pong operations to perform

Parameter.Name: arg.computetime
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of nanoseconds to compute for

Parameter.Name: arg.flopspercell
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of number of floating point operations per cell, default is 26 (27 point stencil)

Parameter.Name: arg.peflops
Parameter.Description: Sets the FLOP/s rate of the processor (used to calculate compute time if not supplied, default is 10000000000 FLOP/s)

Parameter.Name: arg.nx
Parameter.Description: Sets the problem size in X-dimension

Parameter.Name: arg.ny
Parameter.Description: Sets the problem size in Y-dimension

Parameter.Name: arg.nz
Parameter.Description: Sets the problem size in Z-dimension

Parameter.Name: arg.pex
Parameter.Description: Sets the processors in X-dimension (0=auto)

Parameter.Name: arg.pey
Parameter.Description: Sets the processors in Y-dimension (0=auto)

Parameter.Name: arg.pez
Parameter.Description: Sets the processors in Z-dimension (0=auto)

Parameter.Name: arg.copytime
Parameter.Description: Sets the time spent copying data between messages

Parameter.Name: arg.doreduce
Parameter.Description: How often to do reduces, 1 = each iteration

Parameter.Name: arg.fields_per_cell
Parameter.Description: Specify how many variables are being computed per cell (this is one of the dimensions in message size. Default is 1

Parameter.Name: arg.datatype_width
Parameter.Description: Specify the size of a single variable, single grid point, typically 8 for double, 4 for float, default is 8 (double). This scales message size to ensure byte count is correct.

SubComponent.Name: Halo3DSVMotif
SubComponent.Description: Performs a 3D blocking motif with single variable commmunication

Parameter.Name: arg.iterations
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of ping pong operations to perform

Parameter.Name: arg.computetime
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of nanoseconds to compute for

Parameter.Name: arg.flopspercell
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of number of floating point operations per cell, default is 26 (27 point stencil)

Parameter.Name: arg.peflops
Parameter.Description: Sets the FLOP/s rate of the processor (used to calculate compute time if not supplied, default is 10000000000 FLOP/s)

Parameter.Name: arg.nx
Parameter.Description: Sets the problem size in X-dimension

Parameter.Name: arg.ny
Parameter.Description: Sets the problem size in Y-dimension

Parameter.Name: arg.nz
Parameter.Description: Sets the problem size in Z-dimension

Parameter.Name: arg.pex
Parameter.Description: Sets the processors in X-dimension (0=auto)

Parameter.Name: arg.pey
Parameter.Description: Sets the processors in Y-dimension (0=auto)

Parameter.Name: arg.pez
Parameter.Description: Sets the processors in Z-dimension (0=auto)

Parameter.Name: arg.copytime
Parameter.Description: Sets the time spent copying data between messages

Parameter.Name: arg.doreduce
Parameter.Description: How often to do reduces, 1 = each iteration

Parameter.Name: arg.fields_per_cell
Parameter.Description: Specify how many variables are being computed per cell (this is one of the dimensions in message size. Default is 1

Parameter.Name: arg.field_chunk
Parameter.Description: Specify how many variables are being computed per field chunk. Default is 1

Parameter.Name: arg.datatype_width
Parameter.Description: Specify the size of a single variable, single grid point, typically 8 for double, 4 for float, default is 8 (double). This scales message size to ensure byte count is correct.

Parameter.Description: Sets the problem size in the Z-dimension

Parameter.Name: arg.nzblock
Parameter.Description: Sets the Z-dimensional block size (Nz % Nzblock == 0, default is 1)

SubComponent.Name: Sweep3DMotif
SubComponent.Description: Performs a 3D sweep communication motif from all 8 vertices

Parameter.Name: arg.iterations
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of ping pong operations to perform

Parameter.Name: arg.pex
Parameter.Description: Sets the processor array size in X-dimension, 0 means auto-calculate

Parameter.Name: arg.pey
Parameter.Description: Sets the processor array size in Y-dimension, 0 means auto-calculate

Parameter.Name: arg.nx
Parameter.Description: Sets the problem size in the X-dimension

Parameter.Name: arg.ny
Parameter.Description: Sets the problem size in the Y-dimension

Parameter.Name: arg.nz
Parameter.Description: Sets the problem size in the Z-dimension

Parameter.Name: arg.kba
Parameter.Description: Sets the KBA (Nz-K blocking factor, default is 1 (no blocking))

Parameter.Name: arg.computetime
Parameter.Description: Sets the compute time per nx * ny block in picoseconds

Parameter.Name: arg.fields_per_cell
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of fields at each cell point

Parameter.Name: arg.datatype_width
Parameter.Description: Sets the width of the datatype used at the cell

Parameter.Name: arg.nodeflops
Parameter.Description: Sets the FLOP/s count for the MPI rank

Parameter.Name: arg.flops_per_cell
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of FLOPs per cell

SubComponent.Name: UnstructuredMotif
SubComponent.Description: NetworkSim: Performs an Unstructured Communication Motif based on an input graph

Parameter.Name: arg.iterations
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of unstructured motif operations to perform

Parameter.Name: arg.computetime
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of nanoseconds to compute for

Parameter.Name: arg.graphfile
Parameter.Description: Name of the file the includes the communication graph

Parameter.Name: arg.p_size
Parameter.Description: Sets the problem size

Parameter.Name: arg.fields_per_cell
Parameter.Description: Specify how many variables are being computed per cell (this is one of the dimensions in message size. Default is 1

Parameter.Name: arg.datatype_width
Parameter.Description: Specify the size of a single variable, single grid point, typically 8 for double, 4 for float, default is 8 (double). This scales message size to ensure byte count is correct.

Parameter.Name: simpleMemoryModel.nicToHostMTU
Parameter.Description: Sets the size the MTU between the Host and NIC

Parameter.Description: Set the depth of queues between the Host to NIC bus and the cache

Parameter.Name: simpleMemoryModel.hostCacheUnitSize
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of slots in the Host cache

Parameter.Name: simpleMemoryModel.hostCacheNumMSHR

Parameter.Name: simpleMemoryModel.hostCacheLineSize

Parameter.Name: simpleMemoryModel.numWalkers
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of outsanding TLB misses

Parameter.Name: simpleMemoryModel.numTlbSlots
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of requests the TLB will queue

Parameter.Name: local_ports

Parameter.Name: flit_size

Parameter.Description: Size of input buffers in either b or B (can use SI prefix). Default is 2*flit_size.

Parameter.Name: port_priority_equal
Parameter.Description: Set to true to have all port have equal priority (usually endpoint ports have higher priority).

Parameter.Name: route_y_first
Parameter.Description: Set to true to rout Y-dimension first.

Parameter.Name: use_dense_map
Parameter.Description: Set to true to have a dense network id map instead of the sparse map normally used.

SubComponent.Name: linkcontrol
SubComponent.Description: Link Control module for building Kingsley-enabled NICs

Parameter.Name: port_name
Parameter.Description: Port name to connect to. Only used when loaded anonymously

Parameter.Name: link_bw
Parameter.Description: Bandwidth of the links specified in either b/s or B/s (can include SI prefix).

Parameter.Name: in_buf_sizeSize of input buffers specified in b or B (can include SI prefix).
out_buf_sizeSize of output buffers specified in b or B (can include SI prefix).

Port.Name: rtr_port
Port.Description: Port that connects to router

Statistic.Name: packet_latency
Statistic.Description: Histogram of latencies for received packets

Component.Name: BroadcastShim
Component.Description: Used to connect a processor to multiple sieves (e.g., for private/semi-private last-level cache modeling)

Port.Name: cpu_alloc_link_%(port)d
Port.Description: Link to CPU's allocation port

Port.Name: sieve_alloc_link_%(port)d
Port.Description: Link to sieve's allocation port

Parameter.Name: bus_frequency
Parameter.Description: (string) Bus clock frequency

Parameter.Name: broadcast
Parameter.Description: (bool) If set, messages are broadcast to all other ports

Parameter.Name: fanout
Parameter.Description: (bool) If set, messages from the high network are replicated and sent to all low network ports

Parameter.Name: bus_latency_cycles
Parameter.Description: (uint) Bus latency in cycles

Parameter.Name: idle_max
Parameter.Description: (uint) Bus temporarily turns off clock after this number of idle cycles

Parameter.Name: drain_bus
Parameter.Description: (bool) Drain bus on every cycle

Parameter.Name: debug
Parameter.Description: (uint) Output location for debug statements. Requires core configuration flag '--enable-debug'. --0[None], 1[STDOUT], 2[STDERR], 3[FILE]--

Parameter.Name: debug_level
Parameter.Description: (uint) Debugging level: 0 to 10

Parameter.Name: debug_addr
Parameter.Description: (comma separated uints) Address(es) to be debugged. Leave empty for all, otherwise specify one or more comma separated values. Start and end string with brackets

Port.Name: low_network_%(low_network_ports)d
Port.Description: Ports connected to lower level caches (closer to main memory)

Port.Name: high_network_%(high_network_ports)d
Port.Description: Ports connected to higher level caches (closer to CPU)

Parameter.Name: cache_frequency
Parameter.Description: (string) Clock frequency or period with units (Hz or s; SI units OK). For L1s, this is usually the same as the CPU's frequency.

Parameter.Name: cache_size
Parameter.Description: (string) Cache size with units. Eg. 4KiB or 1MiB

Parameter.Name: associativity
Parameter.Description: (int) Associativity of the cache. In set associative mode, this is the number of ways.

Parameter.Name: access_latency_cycles
Parameter.Description: (int) Latency (in cycles) to access the cache data array. This latency is paid by cache hits and coherence requests that need to return data.

Parameter.Name: L1
Parameter.Description: (bool) Required for L1s, specifies whether cache is an L1. Options: 0[not L1], 1[L1]

Parameter.Name: node
Parameter.Description: (uint) Node number in multinode evnironment

Parameter.Name: cache_line_size
Parameter.Description: (uint) Size of a cache line (aka cache block) in bytes.

Parameter.Name: coherence_protocol
Parameter.Description: (string) Coherence protocol. Options: MESI, MSI, NONE

Parameter.Name: cache_type
Parameter.Description: (string) - Cache type. Options: inclusive cache ('inclusive', required for L1s), non-inclusive cache ('noninclusive') or non-inclusive cache with a directory ('noninclusive_with_directory', required for non-inclusive caches with multiple upper level caches directly above them),

Parameter.Name: max_requests_per_cycle
Parameter.Description: (int) Maximum number of requests to accept per cycle. 0 or negative is unlimited.

Parameter.Name: request_link_width
Parameter.Description: (string) Limits number of request bytes sent per cycle. Use 'B' units. '0B' is unlimited.

Parameter.Name: response_link_width
Parameter.Description: (string) Limits number of response bytes sent per cycle. Use 'B' units. '0B' is unlimited.

Parameter.Name: noninclusive_directory_entries
Parameter.Description: (uint) Number of entries in the directory. Must be at least 1 if the non-inclusive directory exists.

Parameter.Name: noninclusive_directory_associativity
Parameter.Description: (uint) For a set-associative directory, number of ways.

Parameter.Name: mshr_num_entries
Parameter.Description: (int) Number of MSHR entries. Not valid for L1s because L1 MSHRs assumed to be sized for the CPU's load/store queue. Setting this to -1 will create a very large MSHR.

Parameter.Name: tag_access_latency_cycles
Parameter.Description: (uint) Latency (in cycles) to access tag portion only of cache. Paid by misses and coherence requests that don't need data. If not specified, defaults to access_latency_cycles

Parameter.Name: mshr_latency_cycles
Parameter.Description: (uint) Latency (in cycles) to process responses in the cache and replay requests. Paid on the return/response path for misses instead of access_latency_cycles. If not specified, simple intrapolation is used based on the cache access latency

Parameter.Name: prefetch_delay_cycles
Parameter.Description: (uint) Delay prefetches from prefetcher by this number of cycles.

Parameter.Name: max_outstanding_prefetch
Parameter.Description: (uint) Maximum number of prefetch misses that can be outstanding, additional prefetches will be dropped/NACKed. Default is 1/2 of MSHR entries.

Parameter.Name: drop_prefetch_mshr_level
Parameter.Description: (uint) Drop/NACK prefetches if the number of in-use mshrs is greater than or equal to this number. Default is mshr_num_entries - 2.

Parameter.Name: num_cache_slices
Parameter.Description: (uint) For a distributed, shared cache, total number of cache slices

Parameter.Name: slice_id
Parameter.Description: (uint) For distributed, shared caches, unique ID for this cache slice

Parameter.Name: slice_allocation_policy
Parameter.Description: (string) Policy for allocating addresses among distributed shared cache. Options: rr[round-robin]

Parameter.Name: maxRequestDelay
Parameter.Description: (uint) Set an error timeout if memory requests take longer than this in ns (0: disable)

Parameter.Name: snoop_l1_invalidations
Parameter.Description: (bool) Forward invalidations from L1s to processors. Options: 0[off], 1[on]

Parameter.Name: debug
Parameter.Description: (uint) Where to send output. Options: 0[no output], 1[stdout], 2[stderr], 3[file]

Parameter.Name: debug_level
Parameter.Description: (uint) Debugging level: 0 to 10. Must configure sst-core with '--enable-debug'. 1=info, 2-10=debug output

Parameter.Name: debug_addr
Parameter.Description: (comma separated uint) Address(es) to be debugged. Leave empty for all, otherwise specify one or more, comma-separated values. Start and end string with brackets

Parameter.Name: verbose
Parameter.Description: (uint) Output verbosity for warnings/errors. 0[fatal error only], 1[warnings], 2[full state dump on fatal error]

Parameter.Name: cache_line_size
Parameter.Description: (uint) Size of a cache line [aka cache block] in bytes.

Parameter.Name: force_noncacheable_reqs
Parameter.Description: (bool) Used for verification purposes. All requests are considered to be 'noncacheable'. Options: 0[off], 1[on]

Parameter.Name: min_packet_size
Parameter.Description: (string) Number of bytes in a request/response not including payload (e.g., addr + cmd). Specify in B.

Parameter.Name: banks
Parameter.Description: (uint) Number of cache banks: One access per bank per cycle. Use '0' to simulate no bank limits (only limits on bandwidth then are max_requests_per_cycle and *_link_width

Parameter.Name: network_address
Parameter.Description: DEPRECATED - Now auto-detected by link control.

Parameter.Name: network_bw
Parameter.Description: MOVED - Now a member of the MemNIC subcomponent.

Parameter.Name: network_input_buffer_size
Parameter.Description: MOVED - Now a member of the MemNIC subcomponent.

Parameter.Name: network_output_buffer_size
Parameter.Description: MOVED - Now a member of the MemNIC subcomponent.

Parameter.Name: prefetcher
Parameter.Description: MOVED - Prefetcher subcomponent, instead specify by putting it in the 'prefetcher' subcomponent slot

Parameter.Name: replacement_policy
Parameter.Description: MOVED - Cache replacement policy, now a subcomponent so specify by putting in the index 0 of the 'replacement' subcomponent slot in the input config

Parameter.Name: noninclusive_directory_repl
Parameter.Description: MOVED - Replacement policy for noninclusive directory, now a subcomponent, specify by putting in the index 1 of the 'replacement' subcomponent slot in the input config

Parameter.Name: hash_function
Parameter.Description: MOVED - Hash function for mapping addresses to cache lines, now a subcomponent, specify by filling the 'hash' slot (default/unfilled is none)

SubComponentSlot.Name: cpulink
SubComponentSlot.Description: CPU-side link manager, for single-link caches, use this one only

SubComponentSlot.Name: memlink
SubComponentSlot.Description: Memory-side link manager

SubComponentSlot.Name: coherence
SubComponentSlot.Description: Coherence protocol

SubComponentSlot.Name: listener
SubComponentSlot.Description: Cache listener(s) for statistics, tracing, etc. In contrast to prefetcher, cannot send events to cache

SubComponentSlot.Name: replacement
SubComponentSlot.Description: Replacement policies, slot 0 is for cache, slot 1 is for directory (if it exists)

SubComponentSlot.Name: hash
SubComponentSlot.Description: Hash function for mapping addresses to cache lines

Port.Name: low_network_0

Port.Description: Port connected to higher level caches (closer to CPU)

Component.Name: CoherentMemController
Component.Description: Coherent memory controller, supports cache shootdowns and interfaces to a main memory model for timing

Parameter.Name: backend.mem_size
Parameter.Description: (string) Size of physical memory. NEW REQUIREMENT: must include units in 'B' (SI ok). Simple fix: add 'MiB' to old value.

Parameter.Name: clock
Parameter.Description: (string) Clock frequency of controller

Parameter.Name: backendConvertor
Parameter.Description: (string) Backend convertor to load

Parameter.Name: backend
Parameter.Description: (string) Backend memory model to use for timing. Defaults to simpleMem

Parameter.Name: request_width
Parameter.Description: (uint) Max request width to the backend

Parameter.Name: trace_file
Parameter.Description: (string) File name (optional) of a trace-file to generate.

Parameter.Name: verbose
Parameter.Description: (uint) Output verbosity for warnings/errors. 0[fatal error only], 1[warnings], 2[full state dump on fatal error]

Parameter.Name: debug_level
Parameter.Description: (uint) Debugging level: 0 to 10. Must configure sst-core with '--enable-debug'. 1=info, 2-10=debug output

Parameter.Name: debug
Parameter.Description: (uint) 0: No debugging, 1: STDOUT, 2: STDERR, 3: FILE.

Parameter.Name: debug_addr
Parameter.Description: (comma separated uint) Address(es) to be debugged. Leave empty for all, otherwise specify one or more, comma-separated values. Start and end string with brackets

Parameter.Name: listenercount
Parameter.Description: (uint) Counts the number of listeners attached to this controller, these are modules for tracing or components like prefetchers

Parameter.Name: listener%(listenercount)d
Parameter.Description: (string) Loads a listener module into the controller

Parameter.Name: backing
Parameter.Description: (string) Type of backing store to use. Options: 'none' - no backing store (only use if simulation does not require correct memory values), 'malloc', or 'mmap'

Parameter.Name: backing_size_unit
Parameter.Description: (string) For 'malloc' backing stores, malloc granularity

Parameter.Name: memory_file
Parameter.Description: (string) Optional backing-store file to pre-load memory, or store resulting state

Parameter.Name: addr_range_start
Parameter.Description: (uint) Lowest address handled by this memory.

Parameter.Name: addr_range_end
Parameter.Description: (uint) Highest address handled by this memory.

Parameter.Name: interleave_size

Parameter.Name: interleave_step
Parameter.Description: (string) Distance between interleaved chunks. E.g., to interleave 8B chunks among 3 memories, set size=8B, step=24B

Parameter.Name: customCmdMemHandler
Parameter.Description: (string) Name of the custom command handler to load

Parameter.Name: scratch_line_size
Parameter.Description: (string) Number of bytes in a scratch line with units. 'size' must be divisible by this number.

Parameter.Name: memory_line_size
Parameter.Description: (string) Number of bytes in a remote memory line with units. Used to set base addresses for routing.

Parameter.Name: backing
Parameter.Description: (string) Type of backing store to use. Options: 'none' - no backing store (only use if simulation does not require correct memory values), 'malloc', or 'mmap'

Parameter.Name: backing_size_unit
Parameter.Description: (string) For 'malloc' backing stores, malloc granularity

Parameter.Name: memory_addr_offset
Parameter.Description: (uint) Amount to offset remote addresses by. Default is 'size' so that remote memory addresses start at 0

Parameter.Name: response_per_cycle
Parameter.Description: (uint) Maximum number of responses to return to processor each cycle. 0 is unlimited

Parameter.Name: backendConvertor
Parameter.Description: (string) Backend convertor to use for the scratchpad

Parameter.Name: debug
Parameter.Description: (uint) Where to print debug output. Options: 0[no output], 1[stdout], 2[stderr], 3[file]

Parameter.Name: debug_level
Parameter.Description: (uint) Debug verbosity level. Between 0 and 10

SubComponentSlot.Name: backendConvertor
SubComponentSlot.Description: Convertor to interface to memory timing model (backend)

SubComponentSlot.Description: CPU-side link manager

SubComponentSlot.Description: Memory-side link manager

Port.Name: network

Statistic.Name: request_received_scratch_read
Statistic.Description: Number of scratchpad reads received from CPU

Statistic.Name: request_received_scratch_write
Statistic.Description: Number of scratchpad writes received from CPU

Statistic.Name: request_received_remote_read
Statistic.Description: Number of remote memory reads received from CPU

Statistic.Name: request_received_remote_write
Statistic.Description: Number of remote memory writes received from CPU

Statistic.Name: request_received_scratch_get
Statistic.Description: Number of scratchpad Gets received from CPU (copy from memory to scratch)

Statistic.Name: request_received_scratch_put
Statistic.Description: Number of scratchpad Puts received from CPU (copy from scratch to memory)

Statistic.Name: request_issued_scratch_read
Statistic.Description: Number of scratchpad reads issued to scratchpad

Statistic.Name: request_issued_scratch_write
Statistic.Description: Number of scratchpad writes issued to scratchpad

Component.Name: Sieve
Component.Description: Simple cache filtering component to model last-level caches

Parameter.Name: cache_size
Parameter.Description: (string) Cache size with units. Eg. 4KiB or 1MiB

Parameter.Name: associativity
Parameter.Description: (uint) Associativity of the cache. In set associative mode, this is the number of ways.

Parameter.Name: cache_line_size
Parameter.Description: (uint) Size of a cache line (aka cache block) in bytes.

Parameter.Name: profiler
Parameter.Description: (string) Name of profiling subcomponent. Currently only configured to work with cassini.AddrHistogrammer. Add params using 'profiler.paramName'

Parameter.Name: debug
Parameter.Description: (uint) Print debug information. Options: 0[no output], 1[stdout], 2[stderr], 3[file]

Parameter.Name: debug_level
Parameter.Description: (uint) Debugging/verbosity level. Between 0 and 10

Parameter.Name: output_file
Parameter.Description: (string)Name of file to output malloc information to. Will have sequence number (and optional marker number) and .txt appended to it. E.g. sieveMallocRank-3.txt

Parameter.Name: reset_stats_at_buoy
Parameter.Description: (bool) Whether to reset allocation hit/miss stats when a buoy is found (i.e., when a new output file is dumped). Any value other than 0 is true.0

SubComponentSlot.Name: profiler
SubComponentSlot.Description: (string) Name of profiling subcomponent. Currently only configured to work with cassini.AddrHistogrammer.

Port.Name: cpu_link_%(port)d
Port.Description: Ports connected to the CPUs

Port.Name: alloc_link_%(port)d
Port.Description: Ports connected to the CPUs' allocation/free notification ports

Statistic.Name: ReadHits
Statistic.Description: Number of read requests that hit in the sieve

Statistic.Name: ReadMisses
Statistic.Description: Number of read requests that missed in the sieve

Statistic.Name: WriteHits
Statistic.Description: Number of write requests that hit in the sieve

Statistic.Name: WriteMisses
Statistic.Description: Number of write requests that missed in the sieve

Statistic.Name: UnassociatedReadMisses
Statistic.Description: Number of read misses that did not match a malloc

Statistic.Name: UnassociatedWriteMisses
Statistic.Description: Number of write misses that did not match a malloc

Component.Name: multithreadL1
Component.Description: Layer to connect multiple CPUs to a single L1 as if multiple hardware threads

Parameter.Name: clock

Parameter.Name: requests_per_cycle
Parameter.Description: (uint) Number of requests to forward to L1 each cycle (for all threads combined). 0 indicates unlimited

Parameter.Name: responses_per_cycle
Parameter.Description: (uint) Number of responses to forward to threads each cycle (for all threads combined). 0 indicates unlimited

Parameter.Description: (uint) Where to print debug output. Options: 0[no output], 1[stdout], 2[stderr], 3[file]

Parameter.Name: debug_level

Parameter.Description: (comma separated uint) Address(es) to be debugged. Leave empty for all, otherwise specify one or more, comma-separated values. Start and end string with brackets

Parameter.Name: rngseed

Parameter.Name: lineSize
Parameter.Description: (uint) Size of a cache line - used for flushes

Parameter.Name: maxOutstanding
Parameter.Description: (uint) Maximum Number of Outstanding memory requests.

Parameter.Name: num_loadstore
Parameter.Description: (int) Stop after this many reads and writes.

Parameter.Name: reqsPerIssue
Parameter.Description: (uint) Maximum number of requests to issue at a time

Parameter.Name: do_write
Parameter.Description: (bool) Enable writes to memory (versus just reads).

Parameter.Name: do_flush
Parameter.Description: (bool) Enable flushes

Parameter.Name: noncacheableRangeStart
Parameter.Description: (uint) Beginning of range of addresses that are noncacheable.

Parameter.Name: noncacheableRangeEnd
Parameter.Description: (uint) End of range of addresses that are noncacheable.

Parameter.Name: addressoffset
Parameter.Description: (uint) Apply an offset to a calculated address to check for non-alignment issues

Parameter.Name: network_output_buffer_size

Statistic.Description: Prefetch issued for a block that was already in cache

Statistic.Name: default_stat
Statistic.Description: Default statistic used for unexpected events/states/etc. Should be 0, if not, check for missing statistic registerations.

Statistic.Name: latency_GetS_hit
Statistic.Description: Latency for read hits

Statistic.Name: latency_GetS_miss
Statistic.Description: Latency for read misses, block not present

Statistic.Name: latency_GetS_inv
Statistic.Description: Latency for read misses, required fetch/inv from owner

Statistic.Name: latency_GetX_hit
Statistic.Description: Latency for write hits

Statistic.Name: latency_GetX_miss
Statistic.Description: Latency for write misses, block not present

Statistic.Name: latency_GetX_inv
Statistic.Description: Latency for write misses, block present but required invalidation/fetch

Statistic.Name: latency_GetX_upgrade
Statistic.Description: Latency for write misses, block present but in Shared state (includes invs in S)

Statistic.Name: latency_GetSX_hit
Statistic.Description: Latency for read-exclusive hits

Statistic.Name: latency_GetSX_miss
Statistic.Description: Latency for read-exclusive misses, block not present

Statistic.Name: latency_GetSX_inv
Statistic.Description: Latency for read-exclusive misses, block present but required invalidation/fetch

Statistic.Name: latency_GetSX_upgrade
Statistic.Description: Latency for read-exclusive misses, block present but in Shared state (includes invs in S)

Statistic.Name: latency_FlushLine
Statistic.Description: Latency for flush requests

Statistic.Name: latency_FlushLineInv
Statistic.Description: Latency for flush+invalidate requests

Statistic.Name: default_stat
Statistic.Description: Default statistic used for unexpected events/states/etc. Should be 0, if not, check for missing statistic registerations.

SubComponent.Name: coherence.mesi_shared_noninclusive
SubComponent.Description: Implements MESI or MSI coherence for cache that is co-located with a directory, for noninclusive last-level caches

SubComponentSlot.Name: replacement
SubComponentSlot.Description: Replacement policies, slot 0 is for cache, slot 1 is for directory (if it exists)

SubComponentSlot.Name: hash
SubComponentSlot.Description: Hash function for mapping addresses to cache lines

Statistic.Name: latency_GetS_hit
Statistic.Description: Latency for read hits

Statistic.Name: latency_GetS_miss
Statistic.Description: Latency for read misses, block not present

Statistic.Description: Latency for read misses, required fetch/inv from owner

Statistic.Name: latency_GetX_hit
Statistic.Description: Latency for write hits

Statistic.Name: latency_GetX_miss
Statistic.Description: Latency for write misses, block not present

Statistic.Name: latency_GetX_inv
Statistic.Description: Latency for write misses, block present but required invalidation/fetch

Statistic.Name: latency_GetX_upgrade
Statistic.Description: Latency for write misses, block present but in Shared state (includes invs in S)

Statistic.Name: latency_GetSX_hit
Statistic.Description: Latency for read-exclusive hits

Statistic.Name: latency_GetSX_miss
Statistic.Description: Latency for read-exclusive misses, block not present

Statistic.Description: Latency for read-exclusive misses, block present but required invalidation/fetch

Statistic.Name: latency_GetSX_upgrade
Statistic.Description: Latency for read-exclusive misses, block present but in Shared state (includes invs in S)

Statistic.Name: latency_FlushLine
Statistic.Description: Latency for flush requests

Statistic.Name: latency_FlushLineInv
Statistic.Description: Latency for flush+invalidate requests

Statistic.Name: prefetch_useful
Statistic.Description: Prefetched block had a subsequent hit (useful prefetch)

Statistic.Name: prefetch_evict
Statistic.Description: Prefetched block was evicted/flushed before being accessed

Statistic.Name: prefetch_inv
Statistic.Description: Prefetched block was invalidated before being accessed

Statistic.Name: prefetch_coherence_miss
Statistic.Description: Prefetched block incurred a coherence miss (upgrade) on its first access

Statistic.Name: prefetch_redundant
Statistic.Description: Prefetch issued for a block that was already in cache

Statistic.Name: default_stat
Statistic.Description: Default statistic used for unexpected events/states/etc. Should be 0, if not, check for missing statistic registerations.

SubComponent.Name: replacement.mru-opt
SubComponent.Description: most-recently-used replacement policy, with consideration for coherence state

SubComponent.Name: replacement.nmru
SubComponent.Description: not-most-recently-used, random replacement among all but the most recently used line in a set

Component.Name: BaseCPU
Component.Description: Creates a base Miranda CPU ready to execute an address generator/access pattern

Parameter.Name: max_reqs_cycle
Parameter.Description: Maximum number of requests the CPU can issue per cycle (this is for all reads and writes)

Parameter.Name: max_reorder_lookups
Parameter.Description: Maximum number of operations the CPU is allowed to lookup for memory reorder

Parameter.Name: cache_line_size
Parameter.Description: The size of the cache line that this prefetcher is attached to, default is 64-bytes

Parameter.Name: maxmemreqpending
Parameter.Description: Set the maximum number of requests allowed to be pending

Parameter.Description: Sets the verbosity of output produced by the CPU

Parameter.Description: The generator to be loaded for address creation

Parameter.Name: clock
Parameter.Description: Clock for the base CPU

Parameter.Name: memoryinterface
Parameter.Description: Sets the memory interface module to use

Parameter.Name: pagecount
Parameter.Description: Sets the number of pages the system can allocate

Parameter.Name: pagesize
Parameter.Description: Sets the size of the page in the system, MUST be a multiple of cache_line_size

Parameter.Name: pagemap
Parameter.Description: Mapping scheme, string set to LINEAR or RANDOMIZED, default is LINEAR (virtual==physical), RANDOMIZED randomly shuffles virtual to physical map.

Parameter.Name: pagemapname
Parameter.Description: Name of the shared memory region to keep page mapping in

Statistic.Description: NUmber of custom requests split over a cache line boundary

Statistic.Description: Count the total bytes requested by write operations
